snippet: The cackles of children rang through Zankel Hall at a charming performance of Debussy’s “Toy Box,” with the pianist Andras Schiff and the Salzburg Marionette Theater.
abstract: Zachary Woolfe reviews performance by pianist Andras Schiff with the Salzburg Marionette Theater at Zankel Hall. (M)
lead_paragraph: The pianist Andras Schiff, who is finishing a season-long Perspectives series at Carnegie Hall, has a reserved, conscientious presence onstage. He dresses simply, in black shirts and black pants, and plays with unassuming, lucid virtuosity. So it was surprising to see him at Zankel Hall on Saturday evening, slumped dramatically over the keyboard. A man in a black catsuit came up behind him with an enormous wind-up-toy key. Pressing the key against Mr. Schiff's back, the man slowly turned it. Mr. Schiff suddenly sprang to life.

headline.main: Giggles in the Concert Hall, Inspired by a Puppet Ballet
